Description: String of glazed composition beads, blue discs, red short barrels, three wedjat eyes, leaf-shaped beads, ankhs and tyets.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): p.87 C. Ziegler, Reines d'Egypte, p. 270, no. 75 V. Gasperini, Tomb robberies at the end of the New Kingdom. The Gurob Burnt Groups reinterpreted, Oxford 2018, p. 83
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1891 / Illahun, Kahun and Gurob (p. 17. pl. XVII)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2008 Jul-Sep, Monaco, Grimaldi Forum, Reines de l'Egypte.
Acquisition name: From: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
